content:
CONNECTDATA Struct

In this Article

Describes a connection that exists to a given connection point.

Syntax

Declaration

public struct CONNECTDATA

Inheritance Hierarchy

  • Object
  • System.ValueType
  • CONNECTDATA

Remarks

The CONNECTDATA structure is the type enumerated through the Next method.

For more information about CONNECTDATA, see the MSDN Library.

The common language runtime throws an exception when a COM method in native code returns an HRESULT. For more information, see How to: Map HRESULTs and Exceptions.

Fields summary

dwCookie

Represents a connection token that is returned from a call to stem.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IConnectionPoint.Advise*.
pUnk

Represents a pointer to the IUnknown interface on a connected advisory sink. The caller must call IUnknown::Release on this pointer when the CONNECTDATA structure is no longer needed.

Fields

  • dwCookie

    Represents a connection token that is returned from a call to stem.Runtime.InteropServices.ComTypes.IConnectionPoint.Advise*.

    public int dwCookie;
  • pUnk

    Represents a pointer to the IUnknown interface on a connected advisory sink. The caller must call IUnknown::Release on this pointer when the CONNECTDATA structure is no longer needed.

    public object pUnk;
